snippet: Adding omega-3 fatty acid supplements to a vitamin regimen to protect against age-related macular degeneration, the leading cause of blindness in the United States, did not slow progression of the disease, a large new study found.
abstract: Adding omega-3 fatty acid supplements to a vitamin regimen to protect against age-related macular degeneration, the leading cause of blindness in the United States, did not slow progression of the disease, a large new study found.

headline.main: Omega-3s Don't Provide Extra Eye Protection

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
